farm1.title: Meadow of Gold
farm1.text: Golden wheat brushes Piggy's flanks. A calf watches with moon-bright eyes. Far beyond, thunder knots the horizon.

choices.label: Chase the calf in a merry loop
Guide the calf gently toward the barn
Stand, breathe, and read the sky

farm2_ribbon.title: Ribbons & Laughter
farm2_ribbon.text: Children run from the farmhouse, laughing. One weaves a ribbon between Piggy's ears and bows as if crowning a queen.

choices.label: Twirl so the ribbon flutters
Nuzzle the shy calf back to straw

flags_text.helped_calf: 'That's the calf's friend!' a child shouts, and the barn doors swing wider.

farm2_barn.title: Hay-Fort Kingdom
farm2_barn.text: Hay bales become castles and tunnels. Dust turns to galaxies in sunbeams; the barn smells like sunshine and patience.

choices.label: Burrow into the cozy straw
Climb the loft and trace lightning far away

flags_text.playful_ribbon_chance: The children eye Piggy's ears, searching for a place to tuck a ribbon.

farm2_sky.title: Reading the Weather
farm2_sky.text: The wind shifts, cool and metallic. Birds dip low. Piggy senses which doors will slam and which paths will puddle.

choices.label: Head to the barn before the first drop
Wait for the rain and greet it kindly

farm3_storm.title: Bruised Sky, Silver Rain
farm3_storm.text: Thunder tumbles. Rain beading on ribbon (if any) dazzles like pearls. The gate bangs; the farmer's wife lifts a lantern.

choices.label: Dance in puddles until the children come
Herd the calves deeper inside
Watch from the loft, counting between flash and boom

flags_text.has_ribbon: The ribbon snaps in the gusts, a pennant of piggy pride.

farm3_barn.title: Barn Heartbeat
farm3_barn.text: The barn creaks and breathes. Calves lean against Piggy; the children hush their voices into stories.

choices.label: Guide the herd, then trot to the porch light
Stay with the calves until the thunder softens

flags_text.trusted_helper: Someone drapes a dry blanket across Piggy's back with practiced hands.

farm4_porch.title: Lantern-Frame Doorway
farm4_porch.text: Lantern glow smears across wet boards. The farmer's wife beckons. The children gasp at Piggy's state - ribboned, muddy, or calm.

choices.label: Leap into their arms, squealing
Strut proudly, chin high
Stand still and listen to the rain's rhythm

flags_text.muddy_pig: Mud freckles the porch; a child fetches towels between giggles.
flags_text.has_ribbon: The ribbon flickers like a tiny flag in the lantern wind.
flags_text.helped_calf: The calf bumps Piggy forward as if to say, 'Go on.'

farm5_hearth.title: Hearth of Little Suns
farm5_hearth.text: Heat blooms from the stove. Socks dry along a line; a kettle murmurs. Piggy's breath slows to match it.

choices.label: Curl near the stove and sigh
Watch the family quietly, learning their patterns

flags_text.muddy_pig: A towel cape turns Piggy into a superhero of thunderstorms.

farm5_kitchen.title: Mischief & Flour
farm5_kitchen.text: Jars, baskets, a loyal family dog. A cloud poofs as Piggy noses a flour tin - snow in summer.

choices.label: Stamp little hoofprints across tiles
Let the dog lick flour off your snout

farm6_stories.title: Maps and Tales
farm6_stories.text: Photos and maps bloom across the table. The children argue about the best place in Aotearoa to roam next.

choices.label: Point at a coast on the map
Point at a forest valley
Yawn and flop; the children crown you with a blanket

flags_text.has_ribbon: They braid the ribbon into Piggy's tail, a comet in pink.

coast1.title: Shells & Wind
coast1.text: Gulls stitch the sky; crabs write illegible notes in wet sand. A fisherman hums a tune older than the tide.

choices.label: Race the tide until spray kisses your nose
Collect spiral shells for a crown
Sit by the fisherman and listen without words

coast2_hut.title: Shack in the Squall
coast2_hut.text: Rain needles the tin roof. Card players shout good-natured insults; a kea eyes Piggy with elaborate curiosity.

choices.label: Offer a regal oink at the card table
Curl beneath a bench until the clatter eases
Watch the horizon through the rain-sheet

flags_text.has_ribbon: The kea is particularly interested in Piggy's ribbon.
flags_text.shell_crown: The kea wants the shiny shells - all of them.

coast3_kea.title: Kea's Red Heist
coast3_kea.text: With a triumphant screech, the kea nabs a bright treasure and flaps toward the headland path.

choices.label: Chase, laughing, as wind plucks at your ears
Let it go, turn back before the drop-offs

flags_text.shell_crown: The shell crown is lighter now... considerably.

coast4_bonfire.title: Bonfire & Shanties
coast4_bonfire.text: Storm light thins. Villagers sing; lanterns bob like tame stars. Someone waves Piggy closer to the fire.

choices.label: Dance clumsily with the crowd
Sit and count sparks lifting to clouds
Wander toward the dark treeline, curious

flags_text.chased_kea: A child ties a simple string where your ribbon was - 'For luck,' they say.

forest1.title: Fernsong Track
forest1.text: Cool hush. Ferns uncurl like sleepy fists; a stream giggles somewhere out of sight. Glowworms might be writing secrets ahead.

choices.label: Follow the chatter of water
Scramble a mossy slope, heart bright
Hum and trot, matching the land's rhythm

forest2_cave.title: Glowworm Grotto
forest2_cave.text: Ceiling-stars. A fox-like shadow watches kindly from the treeline. The air tastes like stone and rain.

choices.label: Bow to the unseen guardian
Snort bravely and nose into the dark
Spin slowly beneath the glow

forest3_camp.title: Wanderers' Circle
forest3_camp.text: A handful of travelers share a pot and a song. Someone strums a guitar; the fox-shape sits a little nearer than before.

choices.label: Share a story of storms and ribbons
Ask for a ridge route to a mountain hut
Stay quiet, count sparks, remember the glow

flags_text.honored_guardian: The fox-spirit dips its head; a one-beat blessing that settles in the lungs.

orch1.title: Orchard Porches
orch1.text: Leaves whisper like old friends. Rain dapples the path; fruit hangs like shy lanterns. An elder waves from a wooden step.

choices.label: Trot over and bow politely
Sit quietly beneath the vines
Balance a fallen fruit on your snout

orch2_tea.title: Kettle Breath
orch2_tea.text: Steam curls. Cups clink. The elder speaks of harvests that teach patience, and storms that teach gratitude.

choices.label: Help stack baskets and crates
Ask about the cottage with the oven
Perform a fruit-balancing encore

orch3_help.title: Shoulders Together
orch3_help.text: The work is steady, companionable. Hands, hooves, weathered planks - all moving in time.

choices.label: Accept a knitted scarf against the chill
Carry baskets toward the lane, trotting proud

flags_text.helped_orchard: 'You'll always have a place on this porch,' the elder whispers.

children1.title: Field of Kites
children1.text: Kites write dragons on the sky. Laughter ricochets across the grass; a ribboned tail trails behind a running child.

choices.label: Chase the streamers with delighted squeals
Steady the tiniest kite flyer with a gentle nudge
Roll on your back and watch clouds sail

children2_games.title: Camp of Giggles
children2_games.text: Blankets sprawl like patchwork meadows. Someone brings out a tin of buttons and declares them pirate treasure.

choices.label: Lead a treasure hunt behind hay bales
Organize teams and share snacks fairly
Tell a quiet story about a fox of light

flags_text.helped_child: The little flyer beams at Piggy as if the wind obeys her now.

children3_fireflies.title: Firefly Evening
children3_fireflies.text: First stars, then a thousand tiny lanterns drifting near the hedges. A chorus of 'oohs' lifts in the dusk.

choices.label: Start a tiny camp with blankets and songs
Run with the lights and try to hum like them
Sit still so they think you are one of them

flags_text.remembers_fox: You hum the cave's melody. The fireflies answer.

garden1.title: Quiet House, Soft Rain
garden1.text: Shoji glow like captured dawn. A koi pond chats to itself. The world narrows to tea steam and the patter on leaves.

choices.label: Rest your hooves, count the raindrops
Offer to sweep the porch dry

garden2_tatami.title: Tatami Breath
garden2_tatami.text: Floor mats smell of straw and sun. On the wall: ink paintings of rivers that keep flowing, no matter what.

choices.label: Trace a painted river with your hoof
Bow to your hosts and thank them

alps1.title: Lantern on the Ridge
alps1.text: Snow-fine air, thin as music. A single window glows ahead; warmth spills onto the path like honey.

choices.label: Trot straight to the hut for warmth
Climb higher to count new stars
Race the wind along the ridge

flags_text.has_scarf: The knitted scarf from the orchard keeps Piggy's neck brave.

alps2_hut.title: Hearth & Maps
alps2_hut.text: Boots stomp snow; a kettle sings. Old maps paper the wall. Stories are traded like mittens - freely, with warmth.

choices.label: Curl near the stove and sigh
Point at a daring dotted line on a map
Trace a river thoughtfully with a hoof
Boop a hiker's glove and oink

cave1.title: Lantern Festival Under Earth
cave1.text: Crystals glow like fruit; lanterns hang in patient rows. A friendly dog bounds up, tail like a metronome.

choices.label: Play chase until the caves giggle
Scratch behind the dog's ears
Bow to the cave's quiet music

cave2_circle.title: Circle of Color
cave2_circle.text: A fox-spirit lifts a paw in greeting. A shallow pan begins to glow like a small sunrise.

choices.label: Spin with lanterns, snout to the sky
Sit and listen; memorize the echoes
Yip softly with the dog and new friends

flags_text.dog_friend: The dog sits on your hooves as if to say, 'Stay' - then lets you go.

final_prep.title: Closing Moments
final_prep.text: Night settles softly. Wherever Piggy roamed - fields, coasts, forest, orchard, garden, caves, or snow - the day has gathered into warm company and quiet pride. It is time to see what kind of feast this journey has called forth.

choices.label: Reveal Piggy's feast
